original_solution_mapping.L1: The entire sq ft of the living room is LxW so the room is 16x20 = <<16*20=320>>320 sq ft
original_solution_mapping.L2: Tom has already put down 250 sq ft so he needs to put down 320-250 = 70 sq ft of flooring
original_solution_mapping.L3: The boxes contain 10 sq ft of flooring per box and he needs 70 more sq ft of flooring so he needs 70/10 = <<70/10=7>>7 more boxes

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 6529.
    Returns: the number of additional boxes of flooring Tom needs.
    """
    # L1
    length = 16 # 16' long
    width = 20 # 20' wide
    total_room_sq_ft = length * width

    # L2
    already_put_down = 250 # he has already put down 250 sq ft of flooring
    remaining_sq_ft = total_room_sq_ft - already_put_down

    # L3
    sq_ft_per_box = 10 # 10 sq ft per box
    boxes_needed = remaining_sq_ft / sq_ft_per_box

    # FA
    answer = boxes_needed
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: The entire sq ft of the living room is LxW so the room is {length}x{width} = <<{length}*{width}={total_room_sq_ft}>>{total_room_sq_ft} sq ft
Tom has already put down {already_put_down} sq ft so he needs to put down {total_room_sq_ft}-{already_put_down} = {remaining_sq_ft} sq ft of flooring

The boxes contain {sq_ft_per_box} sq ft of flooring per box and he needs {remaining_sq_ft} more sq ft of flooring so he needs {remaining_sq_ft}/{sq_ft_per_box} = <<{remaining_sq_ft}/{sq_ft_per_box}={boxes_needed}>>{boxes_needed} more boxes

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: The entire sq ft of the living room is LxW so the room is 16x20 = <<16*20=320>>320 sq ft
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: Tom has already put down 250 sq ft so he needs to put down 320-250 = 70 sq ft of flooring
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: The boxes contain 10 sq ft of flooring per box and he needs 250 more sq ft of flooring so he needs 250/10 = <<250/10=25>>25 more boxes

explanation: Incorrect operand. The variable 'already_put_down' (value: 250) was used instead of 'remaining_sq_ft' (value: 70).
